message.content:
cs.MA, cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.CE, cs.DS

The paper uses an agent-based simulation approach to study the coevolution of game strategies and links between agents in a spatial model. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-category of Multi-Agent Systems (cs.MA). The paper also employs game theory concepts to study the Optional Prisoner's Dilemma game, which could place it in the sub-category of Game Theory (cs.GT). The use of Monte Carlo methods to perform the simulations could suggest the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The investigation of necessary conditions to break the scenarios of cyclic dominance could place the paper in the sub-category of Computational Economics and Finance (cs.CE). Finally, the study of biodiversity and the importance of a spatial coevolutionary model could suggest the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS).
